intro: Haplophyllum dasygynum, commonly known as the woolly bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is known for its compact growth habit. Haplophyllum dasygynum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
